annotations.description: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. Great display from the home side, you have to say that they were the better side today. The home side gave the opposition a hard time by closing them down quickly and aggressively, while the tactic of the away side was slow build up play.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The match has just finished.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: We will have 2 min. of added time.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Raul Navas (Real Sociedad) and Esteban Granero matched up again to find some space for an unmarked teammate.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Asensio (Real Madrid) comes onto the pitch for Lucas.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) leaps to connect with a lovely cross and scores with a header that bounces off the ground and goes inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance to make a save.

annotations.label: y-card

Kevin Rodrigues (Real Sociedad) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the roof of the net, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save.

annotations.label: yr-card
annotations.description: Mario Melero Lopez blows his whistle and Inigo Martinez (Real Sociedad) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Casemiro (Real Madrid) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Geronimo Rulli makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
A goal, which was scored by Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid), was disallowed due to offside.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Kevin Rodrigues (Real Sociedad) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The game is interrupted. Inigo Martinez (Real Sociedad) has violated the rules in the battle for the ball. No protests or gestures are being made as he is quite aware of what he did.
Raul Navas (Real Sociedad) was too forceful with his tackle and Mario Melero Lopez interrupted the game to signal a free kick.
Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) plays a dangerous chip pass into the box in an attempt to set up one of his teammates, but the effort is intercepted by one of the defenders.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Zinedine Zidane has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) replacing Karim Benzema.
Real Sociedad hold possession of the ball and display neat passing from player to player. They are waiting for the right moment to open up the opposition's defence to hit them swiftly on the break.

Kevin Rodrigues (Real Sociedad) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. The linesman points to the corner flag, Real Sociedad are going to take it.

Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Referee Mario Melero Lopez blows his whistle to start the second half.

Well, it hasn't been the most exciting game in the world but there has been some nice football on display. We hope that the second period will bring more action. Both teams are unsuccessfully trying to control the game and it's pretty even so far. Both teams are attempting to play possession football.

annotations.label: whistle

Juanmi (Real Sociedad) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The linesman signals that Da Silva Willian Jose (Real Sociedad) is offside and the referee confirms the decision.

Mateo Kovacic (Real Madrid) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.

annotations.description: Today's referee Mario Melero Lopez rightly decides to book Toni Kroos (Real Madrid) for his harsh tackle.
